result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Sawisky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A Sawisky

records.addlTxt: Return to sender, moved left no address, unable to forward. Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob A Sawisky

Prior: 710 Racine St,1, Racine, WI 53403

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jacob A Sawisky appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Ashley Castro appeared in court for Jacob A Sawisky. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - GUILTY.
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: Credit for time served; 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, reduced to judgment.

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jacob A Sawisky appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Ashley Castro appeared in court for Jacob A Sawisky. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. 
Defense requests another status date to be able to go an see the defendant in the jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
